overview_of_class: This introductory course is designed for undergraduate science and engineering students who are interested in quantitatively exploring the observed universe in terms of the underlying physical processes. The astrophysical topics on the menu include the detection and architecture of exoplanetary systems, the character of the Galactic interstellar medium, the formation and evolution of stars, the active nuclei of galaxies, and the accelerating expansion of the universe.
name: Introduction to Astrophysics
subject: ASTRON
